fields.name: Document Title
fields.value: MetLife LTC LifeStage AdvantageSM

fields.name: Subtitle
fields.value: Plans-at-a-Glance

fields.name: Header context
fields.value: INSURANCE | LONG-TERM CARE

fields.name: Left Plan Label
fields.value: SIMPLE ADVANTAGE℠ PLAN

fields.name: Right Plan Label
fields.value: CUSTOM ADVANTAGE℠ PLAN

fields.name: Plan Type (Simple)
fields.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)

fields.name: Plan Type (Custom)
fields.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)

fields.name: Issue Ages (Simple)
fields.value: 18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: Issue Ages (Custom)
fields.value: 18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA) (Simple)
Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA) (Custom)
fields.value: MBA: $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K; TBA: $75K, $100K, $200K, $300K, $400K, $500K, $1MM* (*$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: Optional Riders Section Heading
fields.value: OPTIONAL RIDERS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGE

fields.name: Shared Care Rider (name and summary)
fields.value: Shared Care Rider: Insured and spouse/partner** can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted; when insured dies remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse/partner's policy at no extra cost; rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; both spouse/partners must have identical policies

fields.name: Nonforfeiture Rider (name and summary)
fields.value: Nonforfeiture Rider: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment or premiums or if cancelled by insured; rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends; provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; available at initial application only

fields.name: Cash Benefit Rider (name and summary)
fields.value: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available with this rider; benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (GPO) Heading
fields.value: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (summary)
fields.value: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; premium for increase based on attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; rider ends at earlier of policy anniversary date after insured's 65th birthday or when insured no longer eligible

fields.name: Benefit Increase Options Heading
fields.value: BENEFIT INCREASE OPTIONS (AVAILABLE WITH CUSTOM ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: Future Purchase Option (FPO) summary
fields.value: FPO: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year; increases occur unless insured rejects in writing; corresponding increase in premium; if insured rejects two times in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases; rider available at any time subject to underwriting

fields.name: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders summary
fields.value: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year by either 3% or 5%, with corresponding increase in premium; coverage increases continue while insured is eligible; rider available at any time with underwriting; options: 3% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider, 5% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider

fields.name: Footer note
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION. Metropolitan Life Insurance Company (MetLife)

tables.caption: Simple Advantage Plan vs Custom Advantage Plan comparison (Plan Type, Issue Ages, MBA/TBA)

rows.value: Plan Type: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Plan Type: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Issue Ages: 18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
Issue Ages: 18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
MBA: $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K; TBA: $75K, $100K, $200K, $300K, $400K, $500K, $1MM* (*$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: page_title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: features_table_title
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

fields.name: Home and Community Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services: Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care

fields.name: Facility Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured’s bed in a facility for any reason

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to lesser of (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added, International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to nonforfeiture date

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: additional_info_title
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal* – 15% Marital** – 15% Residential – 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) – 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

fields.name: company_name
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company / MetLife

fields.name: disclaimer_footer
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION.

tables.caption: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

rows.value: Home and Community Care

Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services: Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care
Facility Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility
Elimination Period
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative
Alternate Service Provision

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.
Bed Reservation
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured’s bed in a facility for any reason
Return of Premium
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate
International Benefit

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days
Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse

Limited coverage provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or the insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date
Initial Needs Assessment

1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime
Premium Waiver
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits
Coordination of Benefits
Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)
Payment Options

Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification
Care Coordination Services

MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.
Discounts
30% Spousal* – 15% Marital** – 15% Residential – 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) – 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

sources.snippet: Nonforfeiture Rider: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment or premiums or if cancelled by insured; rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends; provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; available at initial application only
Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA

Guaranteed Purchase Option.value: GPO (included with Simple Advantage only): insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years up to age 65 with no additional underwriting; lifetime max increase 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time; ends at earlier of policy anniversary after insured's 65th birthday or ineligibility

sources.snippet: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; premium for increase based on attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; rider ends at earlier of policy anniversary date after insured's 65th birthday or when insured no longer eligible
GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

sources.snippet: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

Cancellation.value: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse: limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment or insured's written cancellation after a substantial premium increase; provides full MBA and reduced TBA equal to greater of total premiums paid or 1x MBA; total benefits will not exceed TBA in effect immediately prior to nonforfeiture date

HOME_AND_COMMUNITY_CARE.snippet: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services: Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care

FACILITY_CARE.snippet: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility

BED_RESERVATION.snippet: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insureds bed in a facility for any reason

NONFORFEITURE_RIDER.snippet: Nonforfeiture Rider: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment or premiums or if cancelled by insured; rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends; provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; available at initial application only

CASH_BENEFIT_RIDER.snippet: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available with this rider; benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

GPO.snippet: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; premium for increase based on attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; rider ends at earlier of policy anniversary date after insured's 65th birthday or when insured no longer eligible

MBA_TBA.snippet: MBA: $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K; TBA: $75K, $100K, $200K, $300K, $400K, $500K, $1MM* (*$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider)

INTERNATIONAL_BENEFIT.snippet: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to lesser of (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added, International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

PAYMENT_OPTIONS.snippet: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider 	6 available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO;

reasoningNotes: Preserved the provided elimination period skeleton value (100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative) since it is present in the extraction with confidence 0.8.

Populated Benefit Type, MBA and TBA, inflation options, GPO, Cash Benefit Rider, Nonforfeiture wording, premium payment options, and coordination/care coordination items directly from extraction fields. Many of these come from page 1 with lower OCR confidence (0.6) - flagged with lower confidence.
Bed reservation information lists days and 'actual charges' but does not specify a per-day dollar amount; recorded accordingly.
Initial Needs Assessment explicitly states EP not required for that single visit; recorded as an EP exemption.

Many typical LTC specifics (ADL trigger language, exact ADL list definitions, DME, home modifications, respite details, therapeutic equipment rental specifics, prescription drug coverage, restoration of benefits, extension of benefits, renewal premium specifics) are not present in the extraction and therefore left null per instructions.
Where multiple fields provided overlapping information (e.g., home/community care and facility care), entries were consolidated and sources for each statement are provided.
Confidence reflects original OCR/extraction confidence: 0.8 for most page-2 feature table items and 0.6 for page-1 plan table/rider items. No Azure Search snippets were available.

prompt.system:
You are building canonical data for illumifin claims processing. You are given OCR extraction results (fields and tables) for a multi-page document along with page-level document type hints. Classify the overall content into one or more of: 'facility_invoice', 'cmr_form', 'ub04'. Input JSON includes a pages array where each page has fields with IDs, values, and normalized bounding boxes (x, y, width, height all between 0 and 1 relative to the page). When populating sources, always reference the provided field IDs (fieldId) or table IDs (tableId) and include the page number. Table metadata includes column headers/keys and cell-level bounding boxes; include the column name when pointing to table sources. Then produce a JSON object matching this schema exactly: {
  "generatedAt": ISO8601 timestamp,
  "documentTypes": [string],
  "facilityInvoice": { optional, object with keys "general" (dict of canonical field name -> value object) and "lineItems" (list of dict canonicalName->value object) },
  "cmrForm": { optional, similar structure with sections },
  "ub04": { optional, provider fields },
  "notes": [string]
 }.
Each canonical value object must be of form {"value": string or null, "confidence": number 0-1, "sources": [ {"page": int optional, "fieldId": string optional, "tableId": string optional, "column": string optional } ] }. Confidence is your mapping confidence (not OCR confidence). Populate as many facility invoice fields as possible: policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, invoiceNumber, invoiceDate, taxId, totalAmount, balanceDue, credits. For lineItems include description, startDate, endDate, unitType, quantity, amount, balance, totalDue, credits. For CMR include policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, serviceFrom, serviceThrough, careLevelSelection, absenceIndicator (yes/no) plus absenceDetails (departureDate, returnDate, reason, admissionDate, dischargeDate), insuranceIndicator and insuranceSelections (medicare, medicaid, other), signaturePresent (yes/blank) and signatureDate. For UB04 include providerName, providerAddress. Always provide an empty object for a section if it applies but data is missing. If no content applies, set documentTypes to ['other'] and return empty sections. Do not invent data. Leave value as null when evidence is absent. Provide reasoning notes in the notes array when confidence is low.

rows: Plan Type: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Plan Type: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Issue Ages: 18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
Issue Ages: 18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
MBA: $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K; TBA: $75K, $100K, $200K, $300K, $400K, $500K, $1MM* (*$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider)
Home and Community Care

Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services: Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care
Facility Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility
Elimination Period
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative
Alternate Service Provision

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.
Bed Reservation
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured’s bed in a facility for any reason
Return of Premium
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate
International Benefit

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days
Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse

Limited coverage provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or the insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date
Initial Needs Assessment

1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime
Premium Waiver
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits
Coordination of Benefits
Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)
Payment Options

Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification
Care Coordination Services

MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.
Discounts
30% Spousal* – 15% Marital** – 15% Residential – 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) – 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

fields.name: Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA) (Simple)
Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA) (Custom)
fields.value: MBA: $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K; TBA: $75K, $100K, $200K, $300K, $400K, $500K, $1MM* (*$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: Optional Riders Section Heading
fields.value: OPTIONAL RIDERS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGE

fields.name: Shared Care Rider (name and summary)
fields.value: Shared Care Rider: Insured and spouse/partner** can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted; when insured dies remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse/partner's policy at no extra cost; rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; both spouse/partners must have identical policies

fields.name: Nonforfeiture Rider (name and summary)
fields.value: Nonforfeiture Rider: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment or premiums or if cancelled by insured; rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends; provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; available at initial application only

fields.name: Cash Benefit Rider (name and summary)
fields.value: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available with this rider; benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (GPO) Heading
fields.value: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (summary)
fields.value: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; premium for increase based on attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; rider ends at earlier of policy anniversary date after insured's 65th birthday or when insured no longer eligible

fields.name: Benefit Increase Options Heading
fields.value: BENEFIT INCREASE OPTIONS (AVAILABLE WITH CUSTOM ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: Future Purchase Option (FPO) summary
fields.value: FPO: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year; increases occur unless insured rejects in writing; corresponding increase in premium; if insured rejects two times in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases; rider available at any time subject to underwriting

fields.name: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders summary
fields.value: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year by either 3% or 5%, with corresponding increase in premium; coverage increases continue while insured is eligible; rider available at any time with underwriting; options: 3% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider, 5% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider

fields.name: Footer note
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION. Metropolitan Life Insurance Company (MetLife)

tables.caption: Simple Advantage Plan vs Custom Advantage Plan comparison (Plan Type, Issue Ages, MBA/TBA)

rows.value: Plan Type: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Plan Type: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Issue Ages: 18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
Issue Ages: 18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
MBA: $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K; TBA: $75K, $100K, $200K, $300K, $400K, $500K, $1MM* (*$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: page_title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: features_table_title
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

fields.name: Home and Community Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services: Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care

fields.name: Facility Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured’s bed in a facility for any reason

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to lesser of (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added, International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to nonforfeiture date

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: additional_info_title
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal* – 15% Marital** – 15% Residential – 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) – 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

fields.name: company_name
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company / MetLife

fields.name: disclaimer_footer
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION.

tables.caption: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

rows.value: Home and Community Care

Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services: Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care
Facility Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility
Elimination Period
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative
Alternate Service Provision

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.
Bed Reservation
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured’s bed in a facility for any reason
Return of Premium
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate
International Benefit

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days
Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse

Limited coverage provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or the insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date
Initial Needs Assessment

1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime
Premium Waiver
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits
Coordination of Benefits
Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)
Payment Options

Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification
Care Coordination Services

MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.
Discounts
30% Spousal* – 15% Marital** – 15% Residential – 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) – 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases
